svg.style: background: #ffffff; background-color: light-dark(#ffffff, var(--ge-dark-color, #121212)); color-scheme: light dark;

div.b: Why Residual Connections Enable Deep Networks:

switch.text: Why Residual Connections Enable Deep Networks:

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 278px; height: 1px; padding-top: 460px; margin-left: 39px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 8px; font-family: Arial; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
• Without skips: gradients vanish through 32 layers
• Identity path provides "gradient highway"
• Network learns F(x) = 0 when layer not needed
• Skip connections every 4th block: 8 highways to output

switch.text: • Without skips: gradients vanish through 32 layers...

div.div: Key: Residual connections solve vanishing gradients, enabling the 32-layer depth needed for 10kb splicing context
